text: Tap at Ansaris. Cloudy yellow and not much head at all. Aroma of hops, some citrus. Flavor has some sweetness, hops with citrus and flowers, and a nice soft palate. This is a good beer, but I am surprised it is tated quite so high.

Tap at The Beerhouse in Urbandale. Slightly hazy deep gold body with a bright white head. The nose is amazingly rich with grapefruit and mangos. There is also some wood and yeast bread. The taste is sharp with some grapefruit and mangos character. I get an almost peach snd slight black pepper spice like character in the finish. The body is fairly light. A solid and interesting IPA. Its not mother puckering bitter but there is enough going on to keep it interesting. Very well done.

Bottle; pours hazy yellow gold with a white head; aroma of tropical fruits, pine, and some malt and floral notes; taste is not as bitter as I thought it would be with tropical fruits, light caramel, and some floral notes; dry, light bitter finish with some lingering fruit and floral notes

12floz draft in a medium sized snifter. What I got here is another tropical fruit smelling and tasting (although there is resin too) American IPA. Presented with a two finger head, it recedes and is sticky. The body is a clear gold, and its feel is full and very hoppy. A good occasional IPA, but not one Id have regularly.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2017 Tap at Terza in Rochester MN. Hazy dull golden pour with dense head. Aroma is delicious peach-banana-citrus. Taste follows. Banana flavor is not at all like saison or wheat beer type banana flavor but more like banana bread or something, but doesnt dominate. Good amount of citrus bitterness too. Delicious and huge flavor for relatively low ABV. Lasting peach citrus tingle. Would definitely get again.

Tap at el bait shop in des Moines
Contract brew version. Pours lite bright orange hue with a small soapy whitehead and very lite lacing. Nose is all gum sock dank floral notes but smells like simcoe. Flavors all simcoe no bitterness nothing all that special. Maybe even has some infection. Chalk finish. Not what the ratings show unless they have the actual brewery version.
Pours bright golden with a bit of foam. Nice fresh hops, herbal and pine-needles. Tastes hoppy and herbal. Ripe fruits, mango and papaya. IPA with a great balance, impeccable use of Mosaic hop.

Wow. What an IPA. Pours a hazy yellow. Massive aromas of tropical fruit and melon. Tastes like it smells. Just an absolute fruit bomb. Notes of bubblegum and a great balancing bitterness. One of the best.

Pale golden pour with an orange hue light soapy white head and sticky lacing .... aroma is light but of mosaic hops has that nice combo of tropical and citrusy fruits grapefruit, pineapple, passion fruit, mango, juicy fruits ..... taste is of juicy fruits, tropical and citrusy flavors are balanced, mango, grapefruit, stone fruit/earthy flavors, pineapple and passion fruit ..... really nice balance and mosaic presence with a bitter dry hop bite ..... finish is earthy and tropical with a lingering rindy grapefruit .... solid and sessionable

Old notes from a bottle procured in Minnesota. Nice golden-orange hue with moderate carbonation and a light-to-medium body. Very pleasant hop aromas. Malt flavors were bready, lightly doughy, and slightly sweet. Hops offered loads of citrus as well as floral aromas. Nothing over the top. Just a balanced and enjoyable IPA.
Loads of citrus, grapefruit on the nose and the flavor follows. Light malt profile, just a bit of grain comes through, but still comes off well balanced. Great beer.

Lovely bottle; I was drinking with a geologist, who was especially fond of the volcano. Floral nose, bright in aroma and flavor. Light body, and a bit disappointing for the thinness in the palate. Yellow body. Fine. Bottle.
Excellent IPA. Very hoppy but not too bitter. Clean throughout. Complex layers of fruit pine and resin.

22oz bomber. Pours a golden straw yellow with a three finger head. Aroma is grapefruit, pine, grassy, pineapple, and a not of mango. Taste is pine then grapefruit with a very mellow, almost surprising lack of bitterness. Thin bodied but well carbonated as it crosses your tongue. Overall, the balance is immaculate, but again, like the golden nugget, nothing really pops in this IPA. Still, it is better than most IPAs on the market.
22oz bottle pour was hazy golden color with frothy white head nice light citrus aroma with a bright hoppy citrus flavor.

Bottle, shared at a tasting in Tokyo. Hazy deep golden color. Big white head, dense and frothy at the same time. Aromas: citrus, kiwi, aloe (?). Retronasal its resinous, aloe, citrus. Flavor is citrussy sour, moderate sweet, hop-candy. Light bodied. Finish is rather bitter. Good stuff!

Tap at the butcher and the boar with commonmac. Hazy light orange with medium foamy bubbly head with great lacing. Heavy citrus nose like a northeast ipa. Citrus in taste, again very reminiscent of the Vermont style. Crisp, refreshing, slightly dank. Long lasting flavor. Medium body, professional finish. Well done, dont see this approach much in the Midwest. Taste volcano exploded in my mouth.

Hazy golden color with frothy white head. Tons of mangoes . Super light body, not too bitter. Super quaffable. Liquid candy. But maybe the beer was a bit old as the beer felt a bit faded, but still fantastic.

Thanks Steve.
This was poured into a stemless wine glass.
The appearance was a hazy burnt orange almost brown color with a fingers worth of white foamy head that dissipated at a nice pace. Moderate messy lacing roams all around the glass.
The aroma flows nicely between some tropical sweet to grassy sweet hops with a sharp yet eloquent bitterness from some pine arranging nicely underneath. The malt base exacts itself nicely to complement the rest of the aroma.
The flavor starts sweet but eloquently allows the nice malt base to lay upon the hoppiness ever so nicely. Some caramel to toffee but seemingly just there and appropriate. Subtle sticky bittersweet hoppy aftertaste running into the finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a very nice sessionability about it. Moderate carbonation felt superb along my tongue. Bitterness is there, but still a nice smoothness does roll over my tongue.
Overall, wow, an AIPA worthy of its top numbers on ratebeer and to me. I would love to have again.

Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate tropical fruits and pineapple mixed with lighter citrus and lemon peel. It pours a transparent golden-orange with a two finger white head that fades to a thing film outlined by a thicker ring. There is some thin soapy webbing left on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with moderate tropical fruits and lighter pineapple. The finish has light-moderate grapefruit, lemon peel, and a hint of dank hops, Its light-medium bodied with light-moderate carbonation.

Aroma - ripe herbal, resin, citrus, and floral hops. The citrus holds a mix of tropical fruit to include elements of lemon, pineapple, peach, and starfruit.
Appearance - the body is a hazy amber, with some fine sediment. The head is very effusive. Its challenging to pour, but well worth it. Head is off-white and 2+", and almost never really settles. Stays foamy, and lays fat sud rings throughout.
Taste - is an amazing mix of hoppitude. There is citrus flavored hops, resin - reminds me of head band kind-bud, floral, and herbal hops. The citrus offers a mix of lemon, pineapple, and peach like notes. As the beer fades out the vegetal tones rise. The malt is deep below, but caramel in nature. Sound balance.
Palate - is on the lighter side of medium, the texture is almost smooth, the carbonation is average,

Bottle drunk 11/5/16.Medium-sized, white head tops a clear, brassy-golden-amber body with moderate retention.Very fruity in the nose with light papaya and nectarine-like juiciness. Strong malt backing adds lots of sweet vanilla, honey and borderline caramel. Light lime-like acidity on the end is joined by some pine and mild resin, but the strong malt showing more than balances everything here. No alcohol or flaw.Flavor-wise, its full of ripe pineapple, nectarine and light pine. Moderate carbonation, a bit loose at times causing the rather sweet malt to become slightly problematic and "mushy"-seeming. Some good hop flavors, but just a bit forceful/inelegant overall.
Pours a honey color, with a huge off-white head. Excellent lacing. Sweetness and bittering palate. VERY tasty! I like it a lot. Plus, the bottle has one of the coolest labels Ive ever seen.

Bottle from Michael, Pours clear golden with medium white head and nice lacing. Aroma and flavor of honey malt, skunk modern day mosaic hop cheese, kiwi, grapefruit and resin. A little sweet and grainy but I like it.

Draught at the Toppling Goliath Brewing Co, Decorah, IA. 
Slightly cloudy golden color with a tiny white ring.
Fresh sweetish hops, mild bitterness, tropical fruits, sweetness and some malty notes in the aroma. 
The flavor is orangey, citrusy and piney hops, mild bitterness, stone and fruity sweetness. Perfectly balanced. 



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 65cl. Clear golden/amber with a large, foamy offwhite head and light sediment. Aromas of fruity hops, pine, light caramel. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation. Smooth and juicy. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Bright fruity hoppy flavors into an astringent finish.

Bottle, 650ml. A clear golden beer with a medium size white head. Aromas of fruity hops, especially apples and oranges. Taste is medium bitter and medium sweet. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation, juicy and smooth. Really nice bitter and fruity aftertaste.

Bottle... Pours clear and amber with golden highlights and a large, fluffy, white head. Fantastic retention. The aroma features tea biscuits and honey malts accompanied by a collection of tropical fruits, melons, floral notes and pink bubblegum. Medium-bodied with tingly carbonation. The flavor is nicely balanced  a bittersweet collage of tea biscuits and fruity bitterness. Slightly grassy finish. Bottle courtesy of BVery!

Sample from a 22 oz. bottle. Pours pale, clear yellow, with a medium, cream colored, bubbly head. The nose is mild butterscotch, spruce, and chalk. Bitter and reasonably dry. Medium body, sticky, astringent, and fairly lively. This is a pretty mild, and very interesting IPA. Good flavor and nice feel, but could be more aromatic.

Draft:
Cloudy, light orange-yellow with a white head.
Pineapple, grapefruit aroma.
Sweet pineapple, orangemalt, grapefruit, mango flavour.
VERY juicy.....
NICE !!!

Hazed, bronzed yellow appearance. Blood orange syrup, cotton candy and berry sugar aroma. Feels dehydrated. Tea leaves, dry and earthy. Eventually quite sweet; banana, overripe pear. Mineral components bring a bit of liveliness and spunk. The flavor is similarly tired but remains pleasant; overripe cantaloupe, light bubblegum, and bergamot tea. Candied orange peel, raspberry, currant. Worn out palate was likely once pretty textbook, as the other sensory components also indicated. This bottle has no printed bottling date.

22 ounce bottle from Badger Spirits in Beloit, WI, consumed a few minutes out of the fridge in a Carlyle pint glass. Hazy/foggy deep golden hue topped by a largish frothy head that settles into a .5 cm lasting cream top...earthy, lightly smoky, herbal nose, faint resins but mostly that lovely allium perfume that seems to be a love-it or hate-it thing for beer lovers (LOVE IT!)....body is only lightly sweet, moderately hoppy/bitter throughout, some yeasty-bready characteristics, and a rough onion/garlic sharpness and acidity that is not quite like anything else Ive had - even other Mosaic-only IPAs; its like a bit of onion juice poured into the beer...body is average-tending-to-watery, carbonation moderate. Ive come to love the Mosaic hop, but in this case its a little less interesting and inviting than I find in, for example, Great Danes as-yet-unknown Mosaic Smash; but maybe it just needs more body to bring it out. Still a well-made, quality product like everything Ive had from TG thus far but not one of my favorites at this point. Very cool label design.

Glass, 16-ounce, during Dark Lord Day, trip with Philippe Boutin, Luc Bourbonnière and Ian Guénard, savoured on April 30 2016; eye: golden, lightly hazy, off-white head, no lacing; nose: fresh, hops, citrusy, tropical fruits, slight malt; mouth: fresh, hops, citrusy, tropical fruits, slight malt, semi-dry finale in tropical fruits, medium-full body, good carbonation, mildly bitter, slightly sweet, lightly harsh texture; overall: quite fine

FRANÇAIS

Verre, 16 onces, pendant Dark Lord Day, voyage avec Philippe Boutin, Luc Bourbonnière et Ian Guénard, savourée le 30 avril 2016; il : dorée, légèrement voilée, mousse blanc cassé, pas de dentelle; nez : frais, houblon, citrique, fruits tropicaux, très léger malt; bouche : frais, houblon, citrique, fruits tropicaux, très léger malt, finale semi-sèche en fruits tropicaux, corps moyen-corsé, bonne carbonatation, moyennement amère, très légèrement sucrée, texture légèrement râpeuse; en résumé : bien bon

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2016 Thanks Virby44 for the bottle! Poured into a snifter showing moderately filtered dry orange peel with white foam around the rims. 

The nose shows juicy tangerine but absent any citric acidity. 

The palate is light bodied and fully carbonated. Flavors of nigh impossibly juicy tangerine and sweet pink grapefruit with a very subtle malt backbone with a light and soft grapefruit bitterness on the finish. Another resurgence of pink grapefruit on the linger that seems to go on forever. The impossible juiciness of this beer is beyond comprehension and the fact there is no fruit makes this simply superb.

Really solid tropical fruit hop burst up front followed by dank a little sweaty and a little onion. Soft malt sweetness honey bread a touch of toast. Great nose. Golden color nice head and lace. Flavors are tropical up front dank and onion in the mid palate soft malt sweetness a little honey and pale malt notes soft residual sugar resinous kick in the finish. Balanced and drinkable. Well made. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tropical fruits, mango, passion fruit, sweet papaya, caramel malts, some light honey. Hazy, pale gold, medium, creamy, white head. Light sweet and lightly bitter. Intense tropical fruits, mango, passion fruit, tangerine, some pine, medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, lightly bitter finish with some sweet citrus fruits. Beautiful IPA, excellent aroma and outstanding palate. Keg at the brewery taproom, Decorah, IA.

Bomber purchased at Hy-Vee in Cedar Rapids, Iowa while there for my in-laws 50th wedding anniversary. POURS a clear golden amber hue with great big head of fluffy white foam. Lovely AROMA of overripe and juicy passionfruit / mango / melon, some dank hops, tangerine, and honey malts. FLAVOR of more juicy tropical fruit, semi-sweet tangerine / grapefruit, mild pine sap, honeydew, toasted honey malts, and a bit of dank. Has a playful fruity-sweetness that somehow works well here on top of the mild bitterness. Surprised that it is only 5.5% as it is really full flavored. Excellent stuff here. (167, 1037)
A pretty exceptional ipa. Golden, very well balanced. Lots of pineapple and fresh fruit. Tried with Jess at the brewery in 2016.

Hazy orange to golden pour with a single finger head. Big time passion fruit and mango aroma, just smells super juicy. Medium bodied. Super juicy hop bomb. A little sweetness, like an over ripened piece of fruit. Tastes fantastic. Lots of lace. A little bit of caramel malt starts to creep in as it warms and a bit of bread. Nice beer.

Bottle at Mikkeller Bar, march 25th 2015. Hazy orange body, fine white head. Aroma is hoppy as hell, tropical fruits and mild pine. Taste is bittersweet, resin and grapefruit, extremely refreshing and well tasting. These guys know their stuff all right, a superb IPA!

Bottle. Pours clear amber. Aroma is dank, tropical fruit, wheat, pale malt, and some floral notes. Flavor is crisp and dry with great, juicy hop bitterness faint sweetness and a touch of alcohol spice. Medium body.

Bottle. Deep golden with one finger head. Light to medium body with big fruity hops, tropical and grapefruit in particular. Bitterness is fairly low, allowing the hop flavors to really shine. Really excellent ipa.
On draft at the brewery it is a clear gold with a slight head. The aroma is pineapple and the taste is a sweet citrus flavor that has a bitter finish
A touch old but still a charmer. Very clean and light body, Hops are complex and delicious.

[ bottle ][ 1.5oz ][ @Tasting ][ $? ][ mini snifter ][ 05.01.16 ] 
translucent gold, puffy dense white head. Heavy resin in nose, very metallic bordering on cleaning product, light vanilla-lemon sherbet as balance. Resinous-orange profile, considerable sugar amidst high carbonation, sticky pine heavy overall and clinging to palate.
Clear orange Amber pour with a white head. Aromas of sweaty socks, caramel, dry leaves. Taste is medium bitterness. Yeah its a mosaic IPA but I am a bit disappointed.
Poured a clear orange color with a white head. Aroma was big mosaic character, but some caramel backing too. Flavor similar, caramel plays a back seat, all mosaic all day. Good, not great.

Tasted from a bummer thanks Pablo951. It poured a cloudy golden amber with a large frothy light orange head leaving streaking lacing. Aroma of hops and resin. A mellow orange hop taste with a bit of bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden color out of the bomber with a big, foamy white head. Big fresh dank hop aroma. This is a big, juicy dank hop juice beer. Pine, candied citrus rind, resin and an earth dankness dominate this beer. It has enough malts to balance most of the hops. This is a really well made hop dominate beer.

Bottle share in hotel lobby during RBWG, 01/02/16.
Very lightly hazed golden orange with a decent off white head.
Nose is peach, orange pith, light pine, toasted bread, nectarine.
Taste comprises pine needle, nice dank hop strokes, grapefruit, citric tinged straw.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close peppered with dank hop bitterness.
Solid IPA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: From a bomber. Bright, transparent orange. Tons of tropical fruit amd ripe citrus on the nose. Flavor adds a bit of pine resin, but this remains super juicy. Boozy finish. Quite, quite good, though.

Bottle. Pours gold with nice white head and decent lacing. Aroma is punchy. Citrus hops, juicy. Minimal malt. Taste is a lot of the same, really clean and pure. Somewhat unwhelming overall flavor. Good but I dont think its great.

Bottle with Paul and Max. Pours a bright golden body with thick white lacing. Nose is tropical fruit and dank pineapple. Mouthfeel is smooth and creamy with lots of juicy, dank fruit. The hop profile is fruity but clean. Really nice stuff.

22oz bottle pours a clear, dark gold with some clumpy, white head. Nose has malt, mango, guava, light hand soap, a little cake. Flavor is sweet with honey and mango, pine, soap, mild herbs. Finishes sticky.

Crushed with the Dude. 22 oz. pour. Hazed orangish pour with a small white head. Aroma of mosaic hops, juicy and grapefruit aromas. Flavor is hoppy, lots of nice mosaic aromas. Medium bodied, above average carbonation. Medium, hoppy finish.

The biggest flavor of any straight IPA I have had. And bigger
Than many doubles I have had. Perfect combo of
Bitter and juicy fruit. Solid from top to bottom.

Draft: Poured a bright orangey color ale with a nice foamy head. Aroma of juicy hops notes of citrus and tropical fruit. Taste consist of intense flavours of juicy hops notes of citrus and tropical fruit with some residual sugar notes and almost no bitterness. Body is about average for style with great carbonation. This one is quite the treat and shows that he brewer was really able to extract as much as possible from the Mosaic hops.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2016 Bottled 04/08/16. Pours pretty slightly hazy golden. Aroma is grapefruit, super piney, mango, dank (smells like weed), peach, papaya, slightly peppery note, really nice tropical fruits. It?s not your usual tropical fruit hop bomb. It?s there and it?s intense but it?s amazing. Flavor is grapefruit, pine, mango, peach. Really damn nice. I mean it?s amazing. No other word for it. On the order of one of the best IPAs I?ve had.

Bottle at the May 1st DC tasting. Poured a dark amber color with a medium sized white head. Aroma was a lot of zest notes, tropical fruit notes. Flavor was zesty, lemon notes, tropical fruits. Crazy tasty.
Super sessionable, is this the lowest abv IPA Ive ever had? What it lacks in alcohol it doesnt lack in flavor, as intense tropical citrus flavors are pulled together with a blast of piney hops.

Bottle at the DC RateBeer Tasting. Clear golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of tropical fruit, citrus, floral notes, light pine. Tastes of citrus, tropical fruit, pine, floral notes. Medium body with a dry finish.
On draft at Dark Lord Day. Hooray guest taps! Hazy yellowish orange. Orange zest. Slight grapefruit. Medium bitterness. Nothing mind blowing just a well executed ipa.
Bottle - pours orange gold white head -nose/taste of orange, citrus and salty caramel malt - med body
Bottle. Golden pour with white head. Herbal, grassy, earthy hop aromas. Flavors are herbal, grassy, earthy hop Flavors.

22oz bottle. Medium beige head atop crystal clear apple juice body, nice lacing. Aroma is moderately sweet, juicy grapefruit, light grapefruit rind. Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some pine, cantaloupe. Light-medium body, light resin.
From a bottle at the DC gathering May 1, 2016. Pours a clear gold with an off white head. Fruity nose. Flavors of mandarin orange and a hint of lime.

Non deScript clear orange body with a tight bubbled creamy and attractive lasting vanilla white head. Typical mosaic aroma, citrus, floral, and cat pee. Flavor is good and represents well the single hop. I just had Mosaic promise and thought this is very similar to that beer, albeit more pricey in a bomber at around $8.

A golden ipa with a thin white head. In aroma, sweet fruity caramel malt with loads of citrusy resinous floral hops pink grapefruit, very nice. In mouth, a nice sweet fruity caramel malt with loads of citrusy resinous floral hops, grapefruit pulp , alcohol warmth, beautiful.

Bottle. Gold in colour with a bit of haze and moderate carbonation. Aromas are of mango, bitter melon, light pine resin, and pale malt. Flavors are of mango pulp, white grapefruit, smooth pale malt, dry wood, and a bit of aloe. Not overly bitter, and has some weight to it, but not in a sweet or overly malty way. A touch long in the tooth, but damn tasty in this state. Fresher samples must be exquisite.

Slightly hazy brilliant golden with a thin rocky white cap. Big juicy grapefruit rind and bitter beautiful floral resins on the nose. Brilliant bitter flavor with some grapefruit zest and floral resins, a touch piney/acidic, and lots of pale malt, finishing bitter and zesty and lovely, bright and complex and leafy bitter.

(From notes) Draft at The Iowa Taproom, 3-16-2016. Aroma is very green: grassy character, green onions, scallions, grass clippings. Can you say Mosaic?? Flavor follows with the grassy notes but also a decent amount of citrus with mild floral tones. Love the fact that I get this on draft. Hop profile is alive and flourishing

Lighter in body with a great effervescent mouthfeel. Overall very well crafted and it would have scored higher except it died a little bit in the finish. Maybe a bit to light in body. Still very enjoyable even if every brewery is using Mosaic in their IPAs.
vauw this is tasty. aromas, of pine, marihuana, exotic fruits. heavy bitterness balanced with sweetness. full bodied IPA with an average carbonation. great bitter finish

Had it side-by-side with TGs King Sue. Bottled less than two weeks ago. Poured into Teku glass. Appearence is hazy, golden color with a thick, frothy head that retains very well after minutes of pouring.All mosaic gives it bright, citrusy character. Its aggressively resiny. Many tropical fruit notes: pineapple orange rind, lime as well as floral and earthy resin characters
Taste is again resiny with a bisucuity back notes of the malt. Its herby and got a very dry citrus + resin characters. Its light-bodied, making it fresh. Cant say its easy to drink because it feels very aggressive. Very easy on the tongue and the mouth though in terms of feel.
Bomber pours bright light gold with a big white head. Nose is aromatic, flowery and light citrus. Taste is the same with a long lingering flavor. Fluffy body. Nice drinker.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text:
Tasted from draft at Hunahpu Day 16. Pours clear gold. Aroma is pine and fruity. Taste is very well balanced with a lot of melon flavor, some pine and resin and a little citrus. Excellent taste. Awesome IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This beer is perfect in terms of every aspect. The aroma, flavor, and taste..Its a great beer. Period

Shared bottle with friends. Bottled less than a month ago. Clear golden yellow, with thin white head. Fresh peach mango aroma. Dank mango slightly salty flavor. Smooth mouthfeel. Clean finish. Very well balanced.
Clear golden brown, light white head. Hugely aromatic tropical fruits, sweet mango, honey, light floral notes. Lightly bitter, slightly sweet. Very clean, light body, medium finish length. Excellent.

Heres a fun fact about Mt Vesuvius. When paleontologists explored the site, they discovered many of the corpses were missing their skulls from the jawbone up. When Vesuvius erupted, the resulting thermal waves that swept over Pompeii caught many helpless people in their wake. The intense heat caused the blood to boil. Since heat rises and the excess pressure had to escape from somewhere, these unlucky inhabitants met a rather gruesome end: their cooked brains literally exploded out of their skulls. Drinking Toppling Goliaths Pompeii is a less dangerous experience but no less - ugh, sorry - mind-blowing. The Mosiac hops are juicy, resinous, and piney. Flavors of tropical citrus, marijuana, and grass. Feel is creamy yet crisp. Another fantastic IPA from TG.

Draft/Fest.

A- Pine, citrus, orange peel, mango, papaya.

A- Yellow color, clear liquid, white head.

T- Pine, dank, grassy, citrus.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, bitter finish.

O- Not on the pseudosue level but still a good beer.

Had at the source and received in a pint glass.

3.75 A: Moderately hazed orange tinged golden color. Came with 1/4 finger of white frothy head. I cant comment much on the retention, but a short ring of lacing is left.

4.75 S: Citrusy hops with a focus on orange. Dank resiny hop is nearly as potent bordering on cat piss. Clean neutral malt base.

3.75 T: Mild-moderate bitterness. Big orange flavor and resiny hoppiness. Neutral malt with just a hint of yeastiness.

3.5 M: Medium body. Good moderate carbonation. Lightly creamy and super smooth.

3.75 D: Very good beer, but after having a PseudoSue, it just doesnt compare

★ 642 characters


DavoleBomb, Dec 04, 2015

Poured from a bottle. Bright straw golden hue with big fluffy white head that laces nicely. Some apricot, orange and hints of wet hay stand out in the aroma and flavor. Medium dry and bitter finish on the palate as it is pretty balanced.
Bottle - Mandarin and mango. Clear gold with a small white head. Sweet orange, Mandarin and grapefruit. Big citrus goodness.

Bottle shared during RBWG 2016 - cheers! Pours mostly clear gold with a frothy white head. The nose has some notes of melon, tangerine, pale bread, honeydew. Medium sweet flavor with moderate peach, apricot, tangerine, melon, mild piney bitterness. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Lightly resinous with pleasant citrusy hops, gooey apricot. Nice stuff overall.

Bottle, thanks STLWill! Light hazy orange liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of citrus, tangerine, lime, weed, pineapple, light grain and mango. Taste is dry and medium bitter with notes of tangerine, citrus, light mango, pineapple and lime. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Solid. Very hoppy. Nicely fruity.

650 mL bottle. Clear orange. Smells tropical and citrusy. Strong caramel malt, at least stronger than I expected. Tastes of orange before the hop profile turns dank and garlicky. Hefty sweetness. Medium body. Strong bitterness. Very nice.

Bottle at home. Pours a hazy orange with white head that settles to lace. Aroma is floral, piney, light grass. Fantastic hop aroma. Wow. Taste is floral, citrus, fruity, light pine, faintly sweet. Moderately bitter. A bit of a drying finish. Medium body, high carbonation. A hop bomb. This is a nice beer.
Ive got a cold and the aroma was still amazing - grapefruit, pineapple, tangerine. The taste is mild grapefruit, tangerine and nearly perfectly balanced malt sweetness. A very "juicy" beer. Yummy!

Bottle @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Pours clear amber with a small white head. Aromas of straight up mosaic. Damn. Citrus, orange peel, dank, citrus, herbal notes. Taste has lots of mosaic, dank, watermelon-like fruity notes, citrus, grapefruit peel. Simple, slick and amazing IPA.

22. Thanks again, N! Pours a cloudy medium gold with a loose white head. Nice grapefruit and pineapple nose, beautifully dimensional but not the most forward aromatics these guys have shipped. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Light caramel, grapefruit, and pineapple mid palate, with a clean dry resiny finish. Very nice beer. Digging these guys.
Light amber color with a medium head. Musty, dank hop aroma. Strong citrus, bitter tangerine flavor. Some earthy dankness. Fairly full body.
22 ounce bottle. Pours a cloudy gold with a decent white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, and spice. Taste is grapefruit, orange, pineapple, pine, floral, spice, and some malt. Excellent.

Bottle @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Pours almost clear amber with a white head. Aroma of herby dank hops, citrusy cheese, tropical fruits, mosaic hop pallets and some weak tea notes. Just very fresh and mouth watering. The taste is dank and hoppy with lots of citrus notes and tropical notes. This is just so juicy, smooth and slam able!
Awesome beer! Loads of fresh citrusy hops, very floral, amazingly juicy. Not overly bitter. Just tons of shading hop essence.

Pour out of 22 oz bottle, hazy golden pour with white head, aroma brought notes of big tropical fruit, orange, grapefruit, slight resin, pine, touch of floral notes. Taste was a mix of orange, citrus, nice pineapple, overripe mango, hints of bread, slight pine, finishing slightly bitter. Nicely done.

12/03/15 bomber, consumed on 12/20/15. Golden color, moderate carbonation, 1 inch while, bubbly head, leaving some lacing as it recedes at a moderate pace. Citrus and piney resin in the aroma. Good mouth feel for the style, but not much effect from the carbonation. Good malt taste on the initial taste that transitions quickly to piney and bitter. The bitterness lingers into the aftertaste. Other than in the aroma, I dont get hardly any of the fruitiness or juiciness others talk about. Overall, a good (but not great) IPA with the taste predominately pine and resin. Reading many of the other reviews, I wonder... can this IPA really fade from world class to mediocrity in 3 weeks?

Bomber pour at home. 

Hazy golden color. 

Mosaic is such a great hop. 

Glad I was able to find this.
Solid ass beer...similar to pseudo sue with more flavor...very smooth beer...awesome stuff.

Bottle. Grapefruit heavy aroma with hints of lime and pineapple with some micro hint of perfume. Taste is medium bitter with fruity notes. Medium bodied, oily texture, lively carbination, long dry fruity bitter finish. Awesome showcase of the mosaic hop and shows that TG is one of the best breweries in the world.

Bottle Mikkeller århus. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of hops, juicy, thistle light stale, citrus, grape, passion. Taste is rather sweet, with a hoppy touch of tropical fruits. Light bitter finish. Lacks dryness, a bit stale. Tho well crafted.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2016 Pours a hazy pale orange tan with minimal head and sheets of awesome lacing. Aroma is dank citrus and pine, with mango, peach, grapefruit, and a little funk, maybe a little spice. Super good. Taste is also dank, with tons more fruit juice up front. Then, drying out with more resin, and some pale biscuit malts coming in relief. Ends more bitter, resting on a delicious retronasal and lingering bitter tinge. This stuff is outstanding. I remember Pseudosue being better on tap, but the bottles from Florida cant live up to this IPA. Much more foamy head on the refill - an easy 5 in appearance. More dank grassy funk in the rich head.   On the fence between 4.5 and 4.6 for this one.  My only  complaint would be that its just the slightest bit too .....   you know what?  Forget it.  This is awesome.  For single-hop and 5.5% ABV, this is a masterpiece.  Update:  Head is so pillowy - never seen a head like this.  Overall not as mind blowing as my previous experience.  Great but not awesome.  -2 aroma, -2 overall.

Pours a pale, cloudy, orange-yellow, with minimal head. Dank, catbox aromas, with loads of hop and citrus. Flavor is very dank as well, with spicy, piney hops and bitter, grapefruit-citrus notes. Another winner from the house of IPAs.
Bomber from Hy-Vee. An excellent, drinkable IPA. Not necessarily as unique as some of the Goliaths--straight ahead citrus and pine--but a very strong version.

Cloudy gold orange color. Aroma- citrusy and a tad spicy, wonderful! Taste- light and fruity. Tropical fruit, citrus and a touch of pine resin. Easy drinking and hop-forward. Another top-notch IPA from TG.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

medium golden color, thin off-white head. hazy, moderate carbonation. aroma is strong on peach and citrus. flavor is nicely bitter with notes of perspiration, peach and pineapple. flavor is moderately sweet, but is offset nicely by the hops. very nice beer!

Bottle at Mikkeller Bar Aarhus. Pours a semi clear amber with a small, white head. Aroma has super fresh mosaic hops, light caramel malt, citrus, fruit tea.. If you have ever smelled fresh mosaic hops, its hard to smell anything else.. Taste is nice, smooth, fairly sweet with a very light bitterness, super smooth and floral, lots of citrus peel. A single hop IPA at this price is a joke, but the beer in itself is very nice.

Bottled shared. Pours hazy golden with a small, lacing off-white head. Aroma of grapefruit, lime zest, pine and caramelish notes. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and solid bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent IPA. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Bottle @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Pours golden with an offwhite head, some lacing. Aroma of malt, light caramel, grass, fruity hops, bitter citrus, pine. Flavor is malt, light caramel, grassy, fruity hops, peach, citrus, grapefruit, pine, light alcohol. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, bitter finish with a bit of alcohol. Nice one. 281115

Bomber courtesy of jackl. Thanks! Hazy golden amber, large creamy off-white head, good retention. Aroma of grapefruit, lime zest and toasted malt. The taste is grainy malt, fresh grapefruit and orange. Medium bodied, fresh, well balanced. Nice beer.

Bottle @ MikkellerBar, Aarhus. Clear amber with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, caramel, peach, earthy, grapefruit and a little pine. Flavour is malt, fruit, caramel, hops, peach, earthy, grapefruit, medium sweet and medium bitter.
Bottle @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops, flowers, citrus and malt.
At the new Mikkeller Bar in Aarhus. Hazy golden color with great hed.Very hoppy aroma and flavor.

Bottle @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Clear amber with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - grapefruit and peach. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. Feels a lot stronger than 5.5 % ABV. Oily. 281115

Bottle shared my friend John. Pours clear golden with a nice off-white head and a floral aroma. There is a solid pale malt base with a nice hop profile. Well-balanced and tasty with a wonderful Mosaic finish.
Bottle from John. Pours copper with white head. Nice cat piss aroma with pine. Clean finish

Pours clear golden with almost no head.
Heavy fruity hop flavour on the nose. Light body. HealthKit dose of fresh and fruity hops on the palate. Heavy hop aftertaste. Medium bitter aftertaste.

Bottle. Pours a clear gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a sweet citrus note with a bit of bitterness and a light sweet grain backbone. Flavor has a nice citrus note with a light grain note and a bitter finish.
650ml bottle. Amber pour. Pungent aroma of candied orange, tropical fruit, and berry. Falvor is heavy mosaic, bit dieselly, tropical fruits and berries, bit sweet. Good.

Murky orange/yellow body, with lasting foamy off-white head and nice lacing. Loads of resin in the aroma. Taste is resin, tropical fruit, not super bitter, but loads of hops, a touch of vanilla maybe, juiciness as well, a touch of lactose, and some nuttiness. Overall a fantastic IPA. Cant believe its only 5.5%.

Bottle purchased by blonderedhead at Casanova in Hudson. Fantastic store. Beautiful color with a deep orange and golden quality. Mouthfeel is oily, resiny which is perfect for this IPA. Aromatic with tons of tropical fruit characteristics. Pleasant for sure. Taste is a little bit more mild than I expected but super smooth. Citrus and hops are prevalent and welcomed. Maybe a little sweetness that helps with balance. Its a well done representation of an IPA.

Shared by all time generous hoprider. 
Pour an almost clear brugt prange, not really any head. Aroma is super duper fruity, plenty of fresh tropical fruits. Slight grass ans some floral notes. Really delicious hop goodness.
The taste is slightly sweet from a very delicate malt backbone, with a very well balanced slightly dry bitterness from the middle and out. 
Somewhat watery body, with a rather flat carbonation. Great stuff

This was courtesy of Strykzone. Poured gold with a big white head and excellent lacing. Nose is huge...with citrus, pine, and tropical fruit. Medium plus in body with an oily resinous mouth feel. Flavor is very intense, and their is a big malt base and the tropical fruit, pine and citrus are in perfect harmony. There are floral notes as well. The long dry bitter finish shows some much flavor it just goes one and on. In spite of this this is oh so drinkable. Hard to believe this is a single hop beer. What a treat to have someone send you a beer this great. Thanks Dave.

Pours clear copper orange with a small white head. Head retention is ok. AROMA: pineapple, coriander, malty, herbal/floral hops, caramel, herbs, citrus, tropical fruit, spices, dank, light pine, peppercorn and grass bitterness. TASTE: crisp malts, hop spice, caramelized pineapple, coriander, tangerines, herbs, citrus, grass, tropical fruit, pine bitterness, herbal and light melon. AFTER TASTE: crisp malt, hop spice, citrus and sweet tropical fruit with an oily spiced finish.

grab it, good stuff inside the sticker said .. dark gold .. deep resin and full .. mouth is dank .. very refined and classic boogey woogey juice, another winner from toppling goliath .. . . Two fish in a tank, one says to the other; "You man the guns, Ill drive!
Just about a perfect IPA. Wonderful nose with an equally pleasing hit to the palate. Smooth with just the right amount of bite of delicious Mosaic hops.

22 oz. bottle. Pours bright orange gold with a frothy egg shell head that settles. Aroma has strong citrus mango very astringent resin and spice. Taste follows with more mango citrus pineapple spicy resin bitterness is full through finish. Palate is clean little oily. Very good.

Bomber pours mostly clear with a slight hazy and a medium off-white head. Mildly resinous hop pencil shaving aroma, fruity melon, pineapple, mango, and papaya. Smooth light resin, sweet malt, melon, papaya. Kinda bland really, not bad though.

Pours hazy golden orange color with a nice sized white head and good lacing. Aroma has papaya and pineapple with a bit of dankness and herbal note. The taste is clean and fruity sweet with papaya, mango and melon as well as a hint of garlic and dankness and a medium level of soft bitterness. Semi creamy mouthfeel with a medium body and carbonation. Very nice with just the right level of complexity and flavors to bring everything into harmony.

2015 bottle. Pours a beautiful lightly hazy golden color with a nice big fluffy white head and nice lacing on the glass. The aroma is extremely pungent with beautiful notes of melon, lemon, and floral hops. The flavor is fairly bitter but balanced. Focused on the fruit forward hops. The malt is biscuity and pleasant. Some mild floral hoppy notes are there too. A medium mouthfeel with low carbonation and semi-dry.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber. Poured clear, lighter golden with a nice, lightly-toasted white head. The aroma picked up juicy pineapple, mango, and grapefruit hops over sweet caramel.. juicy and decadent.. loved it! The flavor found similar, with bright, well-balanced, tasty tropical fruits over sweet caramel and lesser biscuity notes.. finished with a nice blend of sweetness and tartness from the tasty citrus. Medium-bodied with moderate carbonation on the palate.. very well-balanced.. excellent stuff!

Pours light orange with quick dissolving head, decent lacing rims the glass though. Aroma is citrus, tropical, pineapple and mango. Taste is big tropical fruit upfront, but the Mosaic bitterness is very prevalent, especially at finish; very crisp, very clean, resiny mouthfeel. This is a great beer.

Bottle mules back from Milwaukee. Pour is dark golden color with very little sediment. Stone is resinous pine. Flavor follows with a light hoppiness that finished just a little on the dry side. Overall, taste is very well balanced. Definitely recommended!

Bottle thanks to bacterial. Cleanish pale pour with some sediment, splotchy white head. Moderately sweet with tropical fruit and caramel. Bitterness is subdued (smaller than light speed it seems). Goes down easy. Medium body, slick texture. A different beast than my favorite IPA iterations, but Id happily drink a few of these.
Tap at Toppling Goliath. Pours Hazy golden with minimal head. Strong citrus aroma. Taste follows, little bitter but not bad.
Tap at TG. Slightly hazy light orange pour with a small frothy head. Pine and citrus. Medium to low malt. Solid.

Keg @ ABR. Light amver with an active head. Dried pine one. Very strong conifer. Some caramel. Taste skews dry. Light cereal sweetness. Floral meadow and Pacific Northwest woodiness. Some citrus. Medium body, active carb.

Bottle. Pour is hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is orange peel, light resin, jasmine, and light malt. Impressive, rich aroma. Flavor is very true to nose with orange, light floral notes, and a touch of resin. Really full bodied and well-balanced. Nice beer.

Thx pepsican randomgarbage. Pours a beautiful gold with a tiny hint of orange from enormous amounts of hops. Head is off white. Aroma is dank and wet hops apricot. Maybe Amarillo. Flavour is earthy hops with a very minor spice and the smoothest but strong bitterness. Finish is unbelievably balanced to only very slightly bitter. Wow.

Pretty nice, pours a medium gold, clear, good head, nice lace. ARoma is to me: sweet soft malt strawberry sums it up really ,with tropical fruits and citrus, spicey peppery and resin. Taste matches with more resin pepper. Nice ipa 5.5% could have fooled me taste is like 7.
Orange pour from 22oz bottle at home. White head. Smells incredible - honey and citrus heaven. Taste is peach, grapefruit, smooth hops, bitter, tropical fruit happiness. Awesome beer
Strong aroma of grapefruit and weed. Very similar to Maine beer lunch. Citruscy and hoppy finish. Pours orange with a thin white head. Had a bottle share with Kaser

5 day old bottle. Amber. Nose oozing out of the bottle. Catty pine, herbal, earthy, with light touches of mango and faint floral citrus. Flavor is more catty pine and mango/pineapple with light citrusy grapefruit. More floral notes. Mouthfeel a little lackluster and could use a bit more malt in the bill. Dry. Good, but a bit let down considering the nose.

Pours a hazy golden color with white head. Citrus fruits, spice, and light pine on the nose; follows onto the palate. Medium bodied. Finishes with spice and pine, mosaic hops really shine through on this one.

I want to hate Toppling Goliath because their brewery sounds like a 90s alt rock one hit wonder, like the band you might see open for Toad the Wet Sprocket or something. I cant give them shit as far as the beer goes because aside form their pretty horrific barrel aged stuff, everything I have tried has been excellent. This one is cloudy orange w/ some nice citrusy tones and a bit of onion, which I generally dont like but comes off as pleasant in this case. Its not too sweet but still full bodied w/ a great, fresh hop character overall. Its nice and drinkable but super flavorful, pretty much exactly what I look for in the style.
Tasty IPA, featuring the mosaic hop. In a world, delicious. Bottle from Binnys. Lasting head on orange body. Great accompaniment lunch.

Bottle. Poured a mildly hazy golden yellow with small sudsy white head. Aromas of citrus, tropical, and slightly sweet malts. Flavor had mango, lemon, orange, grapefruit, pine, and hints of mild caramel. Bitter bite to it too. Body was fairly light and easy drinking, bit of a sticky texture, bubbly carbonation, and smooth finish with a bit of bitter to it. Very nice.

Bomber I brought back from Madison after Great Taste. Just a little haze in this golden beer. A nice 3 finger white head. Sticky lacing. I stick my nose in the glass and delight in the aroma. But it is not easy to describe. Complex? Well that is wimping out. Fruit, grass, lemon, orange, floral, cat pee. That is some of it. All of that is tasted. And now I look at the description and see it is a single hop beer?! There is just so much going on. It does bring that cat pee in the flavor and that is not a favored taste. But this is really good. The rich malts add so much. But so do the complexity of the hop. Really well done.
Bottle shared. Thanks dudes! Pours a golden color with white head. Citrus, orange, hoppy aromas and flavors. Fresh, delicious.

Bottle at Aarons Pre-Wedding Bash. Pour is Slightly hazy golden with a big white head and good lacing. Waxy, lemony, orange peel, some green onion, and biscuit in the aroma. Taste is lemons, oranges, biscuit, grapefruity, doughy, and grassy with a lightly bitter finish. Light body with low carbonation. Solid.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2015 From bottle. Hazed gold with a short white head. New world hop aroma impression is grass, green onion, tropical fruit, burnt pineapple. Mosaic expressed well. Medium bodied, moderately sweet with balanced bitterness. Juicy and fruity, malt is soft, though that could be the yeast in suspension.

Fresh bottle. Unclear orange, white head. Aroma is fantastic. Dank. Citrus. Tropical fruit. Floral. Pine. Everything to like about mosaic.. Satisfying medium body. Smooth. Firm but pleasant high bitterness. Resin and floral bitterness. Dry finish. Excellent balance. Juicy and refreshing. Loads of hop character. Excellent.

The aroma of fresh citrus and pine awakens the senses. The fresh hoppy taste full of pine, fresh flowers, resin and a delightful bitterness is the prefect compliment to any 
Occasion.

Yields a cloudy, sun-yellow color with a fluffy, huge head.

Offers up a fantastic hops diversity, producing citrus peel, riper blood orange, fresh cut grass, as well as papaya which builds a well working bridge, inviting sweeter malts. Tart citrus, together with grass stand out the most, which leads to a refreshing, intriguing hop forward nose. 

Has a medium fitting carbonation, which is spot on, as the taste unload lots of different, tied together flavors.

Tastes of mineralic infused dough white bread, immediately coated up by stronger growing lemon zest and dank grass. The malts then get a tad sweeter, leading to orange and ripe papaya, leaving enough space on the palate for the beers dankness. Throughout the taste is focused on the diverse hops profile, while they range from grassy to fruity, ending with a pleasant, illustrating bitterness. 

Its pleasant, soft mouthfeel unleashes a thoughtful, well composed hop carpet which is indeed very versatile, while convincing, as for its focused hoppiness. Doesnt push it too far, remains easy drinkable and very enjoyable.

Bottle courtesy of Joe, this delightful single hop IPA pours a hazy orange color with a light head. Packs a punch of juicy tropical notes of pineapple and leaves solid lacing. Now, I wish I could just get this bomber EVERYDAY.

Bottle courtesy of Matt, thanks very much! Hazy to cloudy golden yellow color, small white head. Nice aroma of earthy grapefruit and pineapple. Taste starts sweet and fruity, then earthy hay, then a bitter finish. Nice complexity and character. Delicious.

Bomber at Champps. 6/17/2015 bottle date. Excited to try! Cool label .... Orange golden pour with no head. Aroma is huge mosaic hops; citrus, tropical fruits. Plus pine and pineapple. Taste is of bitter citrus, tangy and sweet fruits. Quite tropical. Malt, shrug, maybe there is some, buried. Medium bodied or a touch lighter. Little alcohol presence. Finishes tangy bitter and fruity. Yum! TG handles hops well. 15.3

Pours a hazy golden with a small white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of peaches, mangoes and slight diesel. Taste is of peaches, tropical fruits and light onion. Up there with the best! Body is medium, carbonation moderate and mouthfeel is juicy like it should. Overall a really nice introduction to Toppling Goliath, cant wait to sample their pseudoSue next!

Bottle from Johns Grocery in Iowa City, IA. This store is a must stop if youre in the area.

Hazy orange body with an inch of white head. Oh the aroma...what a showcase for the lovely Mosaic hops. Teeming with tropical fruit and citrus. Delightful palate. Mango, orange, juicy melon. Smooth and tangy. Outstanding.

Bottle 22oz.
Pours hazy golden with medium-high white head. Some lacing. Aroma is of citrus, garlic, pine, tropical fruits. Taste is of citrus, tropical fruits, bitterness, garlic, "sugar". Palate: Medium body, medium carbonation. Overall: Very nice. Fresh tropical fruits. Outstanding IPA.

Orange avec un col qui aurait pu se développer davantage. Ananas, touche déchalote, pamplemousse et papaye, grains toastés et fleurs sont les principaux et nombreux arômes qui viennent me chatouiller les narines. Sur mes papilles, je trouve : des oranges et des pamplemousses juteux, un aspect vert (plante herbacée, aiguilles de pin, fleurs et tiges) tout à fait savoureux, du jus dananas piquant, des herbes et une céréale effacée. En bouche, jai limpression dun corps mince mais crémeux et faiblement infiltré par les bulles. En finale, cest long sur les conifères et les fruits exotiques, presque interminable mais ô combien agréable. Facile à boire, bien évidement. Solide première expérience avec TG et ses bières houblonnées. Je ne suis pas du tout déçu.

Bottle (22 oz). Thanks to Matt for this one! Split with the Québec / Trois-Rivières crew. 

Appearance: Clear golden-orange with a small white head, good retention and some lacing. 

Aroma: Burst of dank hops and garlic with nice tropical fruits features, light resin, biscuity notes and light melon presence. 

Taste: Almost no sweetness despite - like for their pseudoSue - a pretty good malt backbone. Onions, garlic, tropical fruits, light pine, biscuity notes and light to moderate bitterness. 

Palate: Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Ample mouthfeel. Rather dry finish. Clean. 

Overall: Clean and crisp IPA dominated by onions/garlic hops features and a very good balance. Easy drinking. Very tasty stuff!

bottle shared by tom10101, many thanks bro! pours hazy light golden with a small white cap, some retention and lacing. melons, tropical fruit juices, garlic and onions, ripened peaches, doughy fruity maltiness, clean yeast. light carbonation, light-medium body - oily; smooth and balanced tropical-citrusy finish. very good tropical garlic juice.

Bottle shared. Hazy gold pour with nice white head. Aroma is dank, nice fruity hop, tropical, litchi fruit, light garlicky notes. Taste is lightly bitter, nice dank juicy hop, oniony. Palate is med bodied nice chewy body, light carbonation. Tasty.
Orange yellow with thick foamy white head. Aroma of lemon, dank juicy tropical fruit. Taste is similar with biscuit malt. Just an awesome great beer. Well balanced. Shows off the hop well

Bottle @ home. Thanks, Andy! Though this was bottled like two weeks ago, should just throw it in the trash. Cloudy orange beer with a nice sticky white head. Holy pineapple and grapefruit, batman. Super tropical, citrusy, and slightly piney. Good biscuit malts and a touch of peach. Theres a bit of oniony bitterness to the flavor but otherwise dominated by citrus peel and zest. Pine, some tropical fruits, and peach. Mild malt flavor and sweetness, but mostly dank hops. Good stuff.
Wow. Super good ipa. I havent liked ipas in awhile. Excellent use of hop. I guessed sorachi ace but Im wrong. Tasted at chris ultimate bottle share.

Bomber to shaker. Yellow orange pour with a slight haze. Mountainous white head. Lemony fresh hop aroma. Nice juicy hop flavor but with that mosaic cattiness that disagrees with my palate on the finish.

From bomber. Smell of peach and citrus. Beautiful off white head. Not quite as much carbonation as most IPAs. Taste is nearly perfect peach and citrus. Nice aftertaste that is not too harsh, but pleasing to the palate.

22oz bomber. Hazy peach..orange-tan body. Foamy, frothy, steady glass lacing thin white head. Awesome new school IPA. Delicate but bold juicy guava, melon, raspberry tones...all from the hops...new school sensory experience and Im not sure how anyone could rate this under a four if they have it relatively fresh, 6 days from the bottling date when I cracked this one. Pretty much flat out phenomenal. Excellent stuff.
Aroma is pungent hops, spices and slightly perfumed citrus. The flavor is complex hops, grapefruit, mild pine needles, malts, citrus, fruit and a resiny/bitter/tart finish.
Bottle. Orange/yellow pour with a white head. Grapefruit hop bouquet. Taste follows. Average body and mouthfeel. Sturdy malt backbone. Minerally.
22oz bottle pours a hazy yellow amber color with a huge frothy head. Nicely balanced hop profile allows the mosaic hop to be tasted without too much intensity.

22 oz bottle courtesy of Al Carpenter. Shared with ebone1988. The pour is a nice orange-ish gold with a huge white head and some excellent lace as it falls down to a ring with an island of froth. The aroma is surprisingly Belgian for what I was expecting. The bready malts and yeast dominate the front of the nose. There is a little light fruit and a touch of dank pine on the far back. The flavor is surprisingly spicy. The Belgian style really dominates. It's got a lot of clove and bready malt and just not at all what I was expecting. I am not a fan of this one. The mouth feel is decent. There is a good thickness and the carbonation might be a little overdone, but it hangs around. The aftertaste is lingeringly hoppy, which is probably the best part

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with koleminer20. Aroma is tropical fruit, dank, sweet. Appearance is perfect orange/gold, white head. Taste is different. A lot of clove for some reason, none of the sweet tropical fruit I look for in a mosaic-hopped beer, just not that great. Mouthfeel is pretty carbonated, light, not great. Overall, Im very disappointed in this one.
22oz bottle pours a bright orange with a large off white head. big mango orange and grapefruit taste. another great ipa from them

Bottle - thanks Jimmy! Pours hazy orange, large creamy white head, good lacing. Aroma is melon, pear, onion, dank leaves, passionfruit. Flavor is light plus sweet, light plust bitter, dank potty. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel.
Bottle shared by a giant, awesome Packers fan and his friend John. This beer is awesome.

Bottle - Amber pour with a white foamy head and a bit of haziness. Nose is onion and lots of plastic and a light breadiness. Taste is better, with onion, a little garlic, and some pine. A nice toasted light bread base. Smooth and fluffy body.
Share thanks to a Packers fan. Smooth and balanced words words words words

UPDATED: APR 24, 2015 22oz bottle into tulip. Minneapolis. 

Pours cloudy golden-amber. Really pretty white head with lacing. 

Aroma is tropical  and juicy - orange, grapefruit, mango, pineapple. Floral too. Basically no resin. 

Taste is really nicely balanced. Not overly bitter or sweet. 

Palate is medium body. Average carbonation. Soft texture. Medium-long finish. 

Really nice beer. The aroma is really nicely done. Very complex for the abv.
Pours golden orange. Floral nose. Juicy with some orange and lime zest. Tropical fruits.
Bottle thanks to Seth. Pours a cloudy orange with medium frothy white head. The aroma is floral hop and pine. Medium mouth, citrus, pine, juicy, light bitterness, very good.

Poured from a 22 ounce bomber, thanks to Ed. Upon opening the bottle the room filled with ripe, juicy mangoes and grapefruit. The flavor is big juicy fruits as well, there is a soft bready/biscuit malt character. This is the most amazing single hopped beer I have had.

Bottle thanks to Wrye, awesome as always. Pours a medium orange with small white head. Aroma is out of this world stone fruit with the peach really dominating here. This is what I want every IPA to smell like. Taste was a little thin with a little bitterness up front and some citrus notes. The finish is again thin but the aroma somehow lifts this one. Not malty.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Bottleshare thanks to homer. Aroma is citrusy hops and yum. Taste is light, hoppy, smooth, really good. Another beer I could drink all day.

22oz bomber from some dum dums. Poured a nice looking hazy orange with a smaller bright white head. Aroma is awesome, loads of juicy citrus, lime, orange juice,toast, light sweetness, grains. Medium body, average carbonation, dry finish with bitterness on the back of your tongue. Flavor of citrus rind, lime, juicy orang slices, tangerine, toast. Great fn beer.
Bottle from Johns grocery. Nose is danky and fruity. Lots of orange and marmalade. Taste is initially bitter. Lots of fruitiness. Pretty light malt flavor. Overall very good.

From notes on 3/26/15

Sweet juicy slight pineapple taste. Love the hazy golden orange body. Big citrus aroma.
Slightly hazy pale pour with a slight white head. Big hoppy nose. Herbal juicy pineapple. Really yummy. Slight bitterness in the finish.

Crazy aroma - I get hessian (like new carpet), berries, citrus and pine. This is the most intense aroma. Earthy, resinous, berry medley dance along a biscuity malt backbone. These guys have really coaxed crazy aromas and flavors out of this beer. Incredible 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 oz. bottle from Johns Grocery - thanks, &e! Pours a hazy gold color witha finger of cream-colored head that settles into a lasting film. This has a good dose of tropical fruits (pineapple, mango, melon, pear, grapefruit, orange), along with sweet malts, grass, straw, and pine. Light-medium bodied, with moderate carbonation. It starts juicier but finishes drier. I actually liked this more and more as I sipped it, and it beat expecations based on what Id heard so far.

Bottle pours cloudy orange with white head. Citrusy aroma. Flavor matches aroma with citrus hops and moderate malts backbone. Average palate with moderate carbonation and a little hop tingle. Finish mild bitterness. Toppling Goliath seems to focus on aromatic citrusy hops with only mild bittering and this is no exception. Very tasty and drinkable though, I could drink a lot of this.

Poured from bottle to glass. Golden hue with creamy white head that settled. Aroma is pineapple, mango, grassy, resin. Mouthfeel is nice with a medium body and crisp carbonation. Taste is dry with a hop bitterness following. Overall this is a decent brew.

Pours an opaque yellow with a big white head and plenty of lacing on glass. When I first took a smell I thought I smelled flowers but now it is all citrus. A piney sweet citrus flavor with a heavy but not over bitter finish. Overall a good IPA if your not tired of these citrusy IPAs, but I dont get anything spectacular out of this beer.

22 oz bottle courtesy of Johns Grocery (Iowa City, IA). A fresh load of hops on my door step. Pours a well hazed dulled golden orange hue, a more dulled glow and darker hazy middle make this a bit lifeless at first look with something brooding beneath as we go forward. Fuller whitish head atop stays as a fuller, thicker ringer atop. Nice lacing, solid retention in the glass. Aromas are fruity and lively, melon and tropical fruit play liberally. Juicy Fruit gum, mangos and pineapple meld into touches of fleshy papaya, gentle citrus and cool sweeter melon, bubblegum. Gentle bready and grainy malts, jabs beneath that potent but not overwhelming complex fruit bouquet atop. Subtle florals, earth. Initial is lighter end of the fold in body, some punchy bubblegum and tropical fruit come out to fight. Citrus, florals, jabs of melon. The fruit potency doesnt quiet reflect that more juicy nose. Instead, a decent bitterness and lots of green melon start to roll as we move on, a bit more mellow, refreshing and fruity. This one tapers out on the bitterness. Firmer melon, touches of tropical fruit and decent to mellow bitterness catch the palate. Some bubblegum life, jabs of pithy grapefruit and lemon, rind oils provide some tepid bitterness as we round the corner. This thing starts fierce, fruity and full of life and really falls flat on its face, never really gives that potent Toppling Goliath bitterness weve become accustomed to previously. Its a shame that this tapers and finishes as it does, a dishonest bitterness wraps this thing up, floral and earthy, a faint jab of aspirin as citrus rind and bitterness character is quickly fleeting. A beer that strarts quite promising, juicy and alluring that just doesnt offer a creative or potent bitter finish like it should. A bit thin overall but some really nice character in the nose and up front. Overall, its only disappointing because of the hop they used and its lack of coherence from such a "Rock Star" style hop. Nice beer.. but it could have been so much more and I feel like its on the cusp of being there.. but its just missing that bitter bite to counter on the backend and finish. Clearly a different beer than previous years draft only offerings. Founders Promise does it better.

22 oz. bottle, purchased at the brewerys taproom. Consumed on 3-22-15. Pours a hazy orange-tan. Moderate amount of short-lasting, cream-beige head. Liquid looks great, but I wish there were even more and longer lasting head. Tangerine, apricot, grapefruit, and pine scents. Yeasty, fresh, grassy aroma. Yeasty and hoppy taste. Dry, piney, citric, almost acidic (in a good way) flavor. Flavors of pine, freshly cut grass, apricot nectar, lemon peel, and lemon rind. Dry, grassy finish. Nice, dry aftertaste. Medium body. Soft and reasonably lively in the palate. Easy to drink. The palate effects, while perfectly acceptable, dont rise particularly above the ordinary. Overall, this beer is strong across the board. It isnt shockingly great in any area, but it is good enough that overall I would call it borderline superb.
Bottle. Pours hazy orange with small white head. Nose is big sweet citrus. Tastes like candied oranges. Very slight dry bitterness in the aftertaste. Great.
Bomber bottle pours a hazy yellow-orange with a thick head and nice lacing. Aromas of citrus, floral, bread and some spice. Flavor is medium bitter with a slight peppery finish. Yum.

On tap at Dexters, small backlog, pours a light gold with a thick white head and lots of lacing, again, holy hell the aroma is amazing, tropical fruit galore with a ton of citrus, really ripe and fresh, the flavor is much of the same, think if zombie dust and pseudoSue made a baby beer, this might be it, the flavor is fresh with all kinds of citrus and tropical fruit, really smooth mouthfeel, amazing stuff here, kind of disappointed to not see more ratings on this one, hopefully they are still brewing it and others can get their hands on it.

rating number 1300. Gold pour with a good looking white head. Very attractive. Id probably date this beer. Tropical fruit and sour diesel aroma. Clean, bitter finish (not too bitter) with plenty of malt balance. 5.5%? U jokin? Keep up with the high flavored/lower abv garbage. Seriously.

Tried this for the first time at Dexters Pub in Madison, WI, and it absolutely floored me. I registered for an account for the sole purpose of rating this beer. Hands down, my new favorite! (with New Glaruss Moon Man a close second)

Pours a beautiful lightly hazy golden color with a nice big fluffy white head and nice lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is extremely pungent with beautiful notes of melon, lemon, and floral hops. Extraordinarily inviting.

The flavor is very hoppy, but balanced in a way. Not extremely bitter (but very pleasantly so)  Very focused on juicy fruit forward hops. The malt is crisp and noticeable, the fermentation is very clean, and the beer is notably dry. Some mild floral hoppy notes are there too. 

The beer has that nice tongue bracing hop characters that lingers on the tongue and add to the mouthfeel of the beer. The carbonation is nice, a bit low... but this carries the flavors of the beer very well. 

These  Hop Patrol beers just keep getting better.

On tap.
Aroma: floral hops, melon, mango, grapefruit,  hint of pineapple, light pine and resin, some sweetness and bready malt.
Appearance: light golden color with a slight haze, white head with average retention, good lacing.
Flavor: lots of tropical fruit - mango and citrus, ripe melon, grapefruit, just a great fruit character.  Bitterness is medium, just enough malt and a touch of sweetness to balance the hop charge, but not get in the way.  
Palate: light-medium body, medium carbonation, dry hoppy finish.
Overall: lots of great IPAs from TG, but this stands out - very nice!
